definition: to amaze the world with a single brilliant feat (idiom); an overnight celebrity
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to cry (of birds, animals and insects)/to make a sound/to voice (one's gratitude, grievance etc)
to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]

sentences.english: The quiet ones always sneak up on you.
sentences.chinese: 有些人总是不鸣则已一鸣惊人。

definition: to become famous/to become notorious
lit. to have accumulated knowledge and deliver it slowly (idiom)/good preparation is the key to success/to be well prepared
to shine (of talents, skills, accomplishment)/to demonstrate extraordinary talent or skill
to seize/to win
first sign of budding talent/to display one's ability for the first time
to reveal outstanding talent (idiom); to stand out as conspicuously brilliant
to aspire to the throne/to aim at (the first place etc)
to make one's name/to become famous
counterattack

to come first in triennial palace examinations (idiom, refers to the carved stone turtle head in front of the imperial palace, next to which the most successful candidate in the imperial examinations was entitled to stand)/to be the champion/to be the very best in any field
lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
to win instant success (idiom)/to start off successfully
lit. late-comer lives above (idiom); the up-and-coming youngster outstrips the older generation/the pupil surpasses the master
to win instant success (idiom)/to become an instant hit
lit. it takes a long time to make a big pot (idiom); fig. a great talent matures slowly/in the fullness of time a major figure will develop into a pillar of the state/Rome wasn't built in a day
to emerge as a new force to be reckoned with (idiom)
